title: Parisian Dive Bars
name: Parisian Dive Bars
description:
A Map by Tracy_the_astonishing

Paris is full of great, gritty ol' watering holes. Screw those touristy, shiny, cleanish places. Let's go stand in a pile of cigarette butts and drink demis.

******

drinking, beer, wine, kir, cafe, coffee, hang out, talk, smoke, local, color, fun, bar, tavern, watering hole, boire, biere, vin, fumer, clopes

properties.name: Bar Les Paluches
properties.description: Posted by Claude  80, rue de Charonne,75011,ParisNice atmosphere, you can eat and drink, and, last but not least, play Go on tuesday and wednesday

properties.name: Bar des Buttes Chaumont
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Bar des Buttes ChaumontThis is a great place to hang out. The food is good, it\'s off the street, the kids can play, it\'s close to the park.... It\'s not really very divey, I guess. It closes kind of early. Watchout for pigeons roosted above your head if you sit too close to the wall of the building. They\'ll poop right on you.

properties.name: Bar des Trois Arts
properties.description: Posted by Ixwef2 Rue des Rigoles / rue du GuinierLe bar en bas de chez moi, avec de la musique...

properties.name: La Folie en Tête
properties.description: Posted by Claude 33 rue de la Butte aux Cailles, 75013 ParisCrowdy but unique bar - very cool atmosphere! Don\'t go there if you don\'t want to chat with people around you.

properties.name: Le Café Noir
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing65, rue Montmartre, 75002 Paris, FranceUne antique fresque représentant les anciens vignobles de Paris trône entre une pin-up et une peau de léopard. Sur le vieux zinc, un très beau carrelage dédié à la tauromachie. Ouvert du lundi au samedi de 8h à 2h. [01 40 39 07 36]

properties.name: Le Mercure
properties.description: Posted by Kaicarver  84, rue Pixéricourt, 75020 ParisFriendly neighborhood bar with impressive decor.

properties.name: Le Soleil Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing   MenilmontantThis was my first favorite bar in Paris. In the summer you get a table outside and drink cheap beers and see the entire neighborhood walk by. It\'s a favorite busker venue, too. I\'ve had a lot of good times here.

properties.name: Le Zéro Zéro
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing89, rue Amelot, 75011 Paris, FranceMinuscule & Kitsch. Papier peint importé directement de Londres et chaises de récup’ orange, vertes et roses. Ce bar occupe la place d’un autre bar qui servait d’accueil à une maison de passe dans les années 1950. Derrière le comptoir, on aperçoit encore les traces des crochets prévus pour les clefs des chambres.

properties.name: Little Bar--Great Punch
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing Menilmontant

properties.name: Lou Pascalou
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishingMenilmontant

properties.name: Manneken-Pis Bar
properties.description: Posted by Chill888Avoid the snobby tourist trap Harry\'s New York Bar across the street. Where we were informed that drinks were expensive (implying too expensive for rifraff like us). Mannekin Pis was friendly and cozy with a great Senegalese bar-tenderess that now features in some of our vacation photos.

properties.name: Polly Magoo
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  5 rue du petit pont, Paris, France I don\'t think that the Polly Magoo is still open, but when it was, I would say that it was the quintessential Parisian dive bar. The wonderful thing about it was that it was right there, in the middle of town, in the center of the most expensive real estate in the country, overflowing until dawn with seedy drunks and marginal characters of all kinds. Spending a night at the Polly Magoo was always a little bit like going on an anthropological journey. I once saw a woman in her early 50\'s do the splits in the middle of the place, right on the cigarette-butt-strewn and beer-washed floor.

properties.name: Zorba
properties.description: Posted by Kaicarver 137 rue du Fbg du Temple, ParisNice place for a cheap late-night demi. Hole-in-the-wall but not creepy, trendy but not chic. Friendly but not pushy. Open early and late.
